conversations.content: I bought an Adidas T-shirt last month. Could you find the invoice and save it to /user?

<function_thought>
To accomplish the user's request of finding the invoice for the Adidas T-shirt purchased last month, I will first need to view the order history to identify the specific order related to the T-shirt. Once I have the order details, I can retrieve the invoice. Thus, I will proceed with the `view_order_history` function.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[view_order_history()]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

{'Order 1': {'order_id': 'ORDER-104674', 'product_name': 'Adidas Mens Z.n.e. T-Shirt', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-04-18', 'delivery_date': '2024-04-20', 'product_id': 'P030'}, 'Order 2': {'order_id': 'ORDER-107495', 'product_name': 'TechBrand Precision Wireless Mouse', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-05-06', 'delivery_date': '2024-05-10', 'product_id': 'P045'}, 'Order 3': {'order_id': 'ORDER-112543', 'product_name': 'Portable SSD 1TB', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-05-19', 'delivery_date': '2024-05-19', 'product_id': 'P009'}, 'Order 4': {'order_id': 'ORDER-113219', 'product_name': 'SpeedStep Running Shoes', 'quantity': 1, 'order_date': '2024-05-19', 'delivery_date': None, 'product_id': 'P023'}}

<function_thought>
I have retrieved the order history, and the relevant order for the Adidas T-shirt is Order 1, which has the order ID `ORDER-104674`. Next, I will get the invoice for this order using the `get_invoice` function.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_invoice(order_id="ORDER-104674")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
The invoice has been sent to your email inbox.

<function_thought>
The invoice for the Adidas T-shirt has been successfully sent to the user's email inbox. Since the user requested to save the invoice to the directory `/user`, I need to check if I can download the invoice or access it from the email. However, there is no tool available that allows for direct access to email attachments or downloads of invoices directly to specified directories.
</function_thought>

<final_answer>
Unfortunately, I cannot directly save the invoice to `/user`, but you can check your email inbox for the invoice that has been sent. If you need further assistance, feel free to ask!
</final_answer>
